item.title: cloak
item.content:encoded:
According to how the guide is written right now, you need need to obtain the Four Sounds and Bones before you can start crafting your cloak, shades, pistol, and scythe. Obtaining Good Boy, while written before them, is clarified to be something to look out for, but not do immediately in order.

However, from reading this and other pages on the wiki it seems that there is no reason not to start crafting (especially your cloak) the moment you learn distilling.

So, are they actually necessary? if not, it should be reordered. The cloak should be your #1 priority to rush for from the moment you enter the outskirts, since it gives a huge defense against a huge penalty to stamina. Allowing you more stamina to do everything else in the wastelands faster.

item.title: Running Outskirts starting teams: Lackeys for Life
item.content:encoded:
In Season 1, I believe it makes sense running just Snakeman + Haus for the Lackeys for Life team bonus. The bonus Gen levels from this team would help you get Tubby and succeed on a few more Gen missions.

Once you have either Tubby (the only one requiring Gen to acquire), The Twins (give +2 levels to everything) or Flutie (for his Jutsu), it makes more sense to run other teams.

item.title: Addition to the guide
item.content:encoded:
Getting Bones

Once you have any of the following: Flutie, Tubby, Sticky, The Twins, a special mission will appear, called "Rock Out".

Doing this special mission with any of the four in your team will level them up to level 2, but they will delevel at dayroll.

Leveling all four on the same day will unlock the special mission: Battle of the Bands (http://bvs.wikidot.com/mission:battle-of-the-bands)

The mission requires one roll of tickets, Emosuke level 2/3, and has a d16/s16 part, so it is recommended to bring tubby along as well as learn his justu.
